response.body:
<rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:rdfs="http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#" xmlns:madsrdf="http://www.loc.gov/mads/rdf/v1#" xmlns:owl="http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#" xmlns:lcc="http://id.loc.gov/ontologies/lcc#" xmlns:bf="http://id.loc.gov/ontologies/bibframe/" xmlns:bflc="http://id.loc.gov/ontologies/bflc/" xmlns:ri="http://id.loc.gov/ontologies/RecordInfo#" xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/" xmlns:pmo="http://performedmusicontology.org/ontology/" xmlns:lclocal="http://id.loc.gov/ontologies/lclocal/">
  <madsrdf:GenreForm rdf:about="http://id.loc.gov/authorities/genreForms/gf2014026342">
    <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.loc.gov/mads/rdf/v1#Authority"/>
    <madsrdf:authoritativeLabel xml:lang="en">Folk literature</madsrdf:authoritativeLabel>
    <madsrdf:elementList rdf:parseType="Collection">
      <madsrdf:GenreFormElement>
	<madsrdf:elementValue xml:lang="en">Folk literature</madsrdf:elementValue>
      </madsrdf:GenreFormElement>
    </madsrdf:elementList>
    <bflc:marcKey>155  $aFolk literature</bflc:marcKey>
    <madsrdf:hasVariant>
      <madsrdf:GenreForm>
	<rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.loc.gov/mads/rdf/v1#Variant"/>
	<madsrdf:variantLabel xml:lang="en">Oral literature</madsrdf:variantLabel>
	<madsrdf:elementList rdf:parseType="Collection">
	  <madsrdf:GenreFormElement>
	    <madsrdf:elementValue xml:lang="en">Oral literature</madsrdf:elementValue>
	  </madsrdf:GenreFormElement>
	</madsrdf:elementList>
      </madsrdf:GenreForm>
    </madsrdf:hasVariant>
    <madsrdf:hasVariant>
      <madsrdf:GenreForm>
	<rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.loc.gov/mads/rdf/v1#Variant"/>
	<madsrdf:variantLabel xml:lang="en">Traditional literature</madsrdf:variantLabel>
	<madsrdf:elementList rdf:parseType="Collection">
	  <madsrdf:GenreFormElement>
	    <madsrdf:elementValue xml:lang="en">Traditional literature</madsrdf:elementValue>
	  </madsrdf:GenreFormElement>
	</madsrdf:elementList>
      </madsrdf:GenreForm>
    </madsrdf:hasVariant>
    <madsrdf:hasSource>
      <madsrdf:Source>
	<madsrdf:citationStatus>found</madsrdf:citationStatus>
	<madsrdf:citationSource>Encyclop√¶dia Britannica online, Apr. 8, 2013</madsrdf:citationSource>
	<madsrdf:citationNote xml:lang="en">(folk literature, also called folklore or oral tradition, the lore (traditional knowledge and beliefs) of cultures having no written language. It is transmitted by word of mouth and consists, as does written literature, of both prose and verse narratives, poems and songs, myths, dramas, rituals, proverbs, riddles, and the like.)</madsrdf:citationNote>
      </madsrdf:Source>
    </madsrdf:hasSource>
    <madsrdf:hasSource>
      <madsrdf:Source>
	<madsrdf:citationStatus>found</madsrdf:citationStatus>
	<madsrdf:citationSource>Southern Connecticut State University website Literature for children, viewed Apr. 8, 2013</madsrdf:citationSource>
	<madsrdf:citationNote xml:lang="en">(Folk literature. Definition: Folk or traditional literature is the collection of tales passed from generation to generation and from the old to the young by word of mouth (also called the oral tradition). Folk literature is believed to be people's efforts to organize their experiences into meaningful patterns. Folk literature includes fairy tales, myths, legends, fables, tall tales, and other oral traditions of preliterate societies.)</madsrdf:citationNote>
      </madsrdf:Source>
    </madsrdf:hasSource>
    <madsrdf:hasSource>
      <madsrdf:Source>
	<madsrdf:citationStatus>found</madsrdf:citationStatus>
	<madsrdf:citationSource>Harmon, W. A handbook to literature, c2009</madsrdf:citationSource>
	<madsrdf:citationNote xml:lang="en">(Folklore. Folklore includes myths, legends, stories, riddles, proverbs, nursery rhymes, charms, spells, omens, beliefs of all sorts, popular ballads, cowboy songs, plant lore, animal lore, and customs dealing with birth, initiation, courtship, marriage, medicine, work, amusements, and death.)</madsrdf:citationNote>
      </madsrdf:Source>
    </madsrdf:hasSource>
    <madsrdf:hasSource>
      <madsrdf:Source>
	<madsrdf:citationStatus>found</madsrdf:citationStatus>
	<madsrdf:citationSource>LCSH, Oct. 22, 2014</madsrdf:citationSource>
	<madsrdf:citationNote xml:lang="en">(Folk literature. UF Oral literature. BT Literature)</madsrdf:citationNote>
      </madsrdf:Source>
    </madsrdf:hasSource>
    <madsrdf:note>Works based on oral traditions.</madsrdf:note>
